file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Carrick Station. We're back, Master Satele.
Chandrila is safe, Darth Ikoral is defeated and Republic teams have secured his warship. Our victory is complete.
We've also received an interesting communique. Stand by....
The Sith Empire extends its congratulations for your victory over Darth Ikoral. Know that his actions were not sanctioned by the Emperor.
Also know that we've learned the identities of your strike team members. Should they invade Imperial territory again, there will be consequences.
Malgus is looking for any excuse to declare war on the Republic.
He's taunting us.
I believe it may be the opposite. You've destroyed another powerful Sith Lord and shown that the dark side can be defeated.
Unless Malgus had spies aboard that ship--or this station--there's no way he could know about us.
He shouldn't know us.
Our security is always at risk. But if he's bluffing, it implies a certain desperation, don't you agree?
The only consequence will be when Havoc Squad tears down Dromund Kaas brick by stinking brick.
Blasted right, there will.
There are many more battles to fight before that moment.
That's a Sith for you. Subtle as a thermal detonator, and twice as ugly.
What a repulsive blowhard.
He did not choose his face. It chose him.
Bring it on, Malgus.
It isn't like a Sith to issue threats. I believe he's... worried.
That was barely worth my time.
This is the first time I've ever sensed uncertainty in that man, and you inspired it.
A confrontation with Malgus appears inevitable, but not today. For now, our focus should be to honor those we lost.
Your service has been exemplary, as always. Stay safe--and may the Force be with you.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Carrick Station, responding to emergency command protocol "corestar."
Good. Listen carefully. Nineteen hours ago, we lost contact with the Jedi enclave on Rhinnal. The Republic patrol frigate "Toron Voq" went to investigate.
The vessel's crew reported the enclave had been slaughtered. No survivors. As we were speaking, the Toron Voq came under heavy fire.
Its captain only had enough time to transmit images of a Sith warship before he and his vessel were destroyed.
The enemy must have been hiding. They destroyed the enclave and waited for us to send a ship.
We fell into a trap.
Later reconnaissance has revealed that the Sith took their time butchering our people. They were just leaving when the Toron Voq arrived.
If we got a unique signature reading on that Sith attacker, we can hunt it down.
Did we ID the enemy ship?
Our one consolation is that the enemy vessel is unique. It's a ship design that hasn't been seen in decades.
That's it--we're at war!
This was not an attack by the Empire--at least, not the Empire we've been facing.
Three hours ago, we intercepted a coded transmission from Darth Malgus to the Sith Dark Council. Stand by....
The destruction of Lord Senu's fortress was but a prelude. Our enemy intends to purge the Empire of any Sith who lacks pure blood.
Darth Ikoral will continue to attack both our positions and the Republic until he is stopped.
Why is this Sith attacking his own people?
We have a common enemy.
Darth Ikoral believes only pure-blooded Sith like him are worthy of survival. All others should be exterminated to maintain Sith purity.
What do we know about this renegade Sith?
Darth Ikoral?
He was a famous leader who left the Empire seeking remnants of pure-blooded Sith over seventy years ago. It seems he found them
It sounds like our favorite Sith Lord plans to do our job for us.
Let Malgus handle him.
We cannot wait for the Empire to clean up this mess. Darth Ikoral's warship was just detected near Chandrila, a major agricultural world.
If that insane Sith destroys our food production centers, billions will starve.
I was too late to save Uphrades from Darth Angral. I won't fail a second time.
Not on my watch. Never again.
The failure at Uphrades was not yours--but you understand what's at stake.
I'm determined to preserve the Republic's security--and feed our allies. What's the plan?
I won't permit that.
We must intercept our enemy before he reaches his target.
That Sith is about to find out he picked the wrong fight.
Enough is enough. Let's fight.
Let us hope the enemy is unprepared for your tactics.
If that happened, I could earn a fortune hauling grain around the galaxy--but I won't.
We can't have that.
I'm glad that your first instincts were humanitarian.
How do we prevent that?
How do we know Malgus and Ikoral aren't working together to draw us out?
Are we walking into a trap?
Our scouts have verified that two enemy fortresses commanded by alien Sith were destroyed. This is no bluff.
The datalogs on Darth Ikoral's warship contain decades of valuable strategic data we desperately need--and you've proven capable of capturing any vessel.
Our fleet is on its way to Chandrila. Rendezvous in the attack shuttle I've commissioned at Carrick Station. Defeat Darth Ikoral. Take his ship.
Are you sure facing that Sith head-on is the best plan?
You're asking a lot.
This isn't about him. The astrogation routes and galaxy map on his vessel will help us topple the Sith Empire.
I can sense the strain you're under, Master. Were you close to someone at the Jedi enclave that was destroyed?
Are you alright?
I sensed the deaths of many Jedi, all at once. The last time I felt that was when the temple on Coruscant was destroyed.
Sounds like you're taking this personally. I thought Jedi weren't supposed to do that.
Are you alright?
I simply want justice. You can provide that.
The Sith are as good as dead.
Do not misunderstand me. I'm not sending you to assassinate--only to ensure our people did not die for nothing.
Hurry to your shuttle. May the Force be with you.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
